query: Why was Sindhuka referred to as a special bird?

One day, a hunter came to the tree in search of prey and he saw Sindhuka’s droppings hit the ground and turn into gold\.
The hunter was struck with wonder\.
The hunter thought, “I have been hunting birds and small animals since I was a boy, but in all my 80 years, I have never seen such a miraculous creature\.“
The hunter decided that he had to catch the bird somehow\.
